quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Person and Ratings
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, people, nascar. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This sportsman has been a great NHL player and head coach and part-owner of the Phoenix Coyotes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wayne Gretzky

questions.question: The ratings for the Beijing Olympics were far above those of the Athens Olympics. This is due, in part, to this man, the Chairman of Sports at NBC in 2008.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dick Ebersol

questions.question: Bill Bowerman and this man co-founded the sports line Nike.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil Knight

questions.question: When he was made the Commissioner of the NHL in 1993, he was asked to bring it back to popularity in the USA. Who is this person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Bettman

questions.question: This person was a great basketball player, a poor outfielder, and a minority stockholder in the Charlotte Bobcats of the NBA. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jordan

questions.question: This American businessman is one of the founders of Home Depot and owner of the NFL Atlanta Falcons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arthur Blank

questions.question: Which of these people has been a Commissioner of the NBA for over 24 years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Stern

questions.question: Who is the owner of the Denver Broncos?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Bowlen

questions.question: This person was one of the first great skateboarders and a video game icon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Hawk

questions.question: Which of these men is not associated with NASCAR?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric Grubman

questions.question: The presence of two members of this sports family raises the TV ratings at tennis tournaments even when they are not winning.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Williams

questions.question: This person is considered the most important man in the world of golf. Without him, PGA Tour events get very low TV ratings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tiger Woods

questions.question: Which family owns the Pitsburgh Steelers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rooney

questions.question: Who was the President of Entertainment and Sports Programming Network (ESPN) in 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bodenheimer

questions.question: This giant company owns The Home Depot center, The Los Angeles Kings, The L.A. Galaxy, the Houston Dynamo, the David Beckham Academy, ATP London, the Los Angeles Riptides, the Staples Center, and almost one-eighth of the Los Angeles Lakers. What is the name of this company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anschutz Entertainment Group

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Southern California and Player
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, field, bush. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the home field of the Southern California Trojans football team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum

questions.question: Which statement describes best the University of Southern California?

options.text: It is a state school located in Westwood, California
It is a state school located in Los Angeles, California.
It is a private school located in Los Angeles, California.
It is a private school located in Palo Alto, California.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a private school located in Los Angeles, California.

questions.question: The first player form the University of Southern California to win the Outland Trophy (for best college lineman) became a solid left offensive tackle for the Minnesota Vikings. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Yary

questions.question: This former University of Southern California Trojans player became an All-Star offensive tackle in the old AFL.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Mix

questions.question: In what year did Marcus Allen from the Southern California Trojans win the Heisman award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1981

questions.question: He founded „Little Caesars Pizza” in 1959. He is the owner of the Detroit Red Wings of the NHL and the Detroit Tigers of Major League Baseball. Who i sthies person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Ilitch

questions.question: Who was the first Southern California Trojans player to win the Heisman award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Garrett

questions.question: What are the colors of the Southern California Trojans football team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cardinal and gold

questions.question: In 2005 Reggie Bush from the Southern California Trojans won what individual award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heisman Trophy

questions.question: In what year did the Southern California Trojans finish the football season untied and undefeated for the fourth time in the teams history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2004

questions.question: Who is the founder of the group that owns Gillette Stadium, the New England Revolution, Rand-Whitney Container Corp, and the New England Patriots?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Kraft

questions.question: In which athletic conference do the Southern California Trojans teams participate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: PAC-10

questions.question: This former player from the University of Southern California Trojans was voted to the NFL All Pro Team as both offensive and defensive back. Who is this famous number 16?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Gifford

questions.question: Whhich is the official bank of the NFL and Major League Baseball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bank of  America

questions.question: Which colleges have been among Southern California Trojans’ bitter rivals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: UCLA and Notre Dame

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Baseball and World Series
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, cubs, philip. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which slugger from the Chicago Cubs had the most career Home Runs playing for his team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sammy Sosa

questions.question: This former player of the Southern California Trojans also played DB for the New York Giants but is perhaps more famous for proposing to actress Angie Harmon on The Tonight Show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jason Sehorn

questions.question: In what year did the two Chicago baseball teams, Cubs and Sox play each other in the World Series and who won?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1906 and the Sox winning

questions.question: Which former University of Southern California Trojans member lost the race for Governor of Pennsylvania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynn Swann

questions.question: The first All Star games of baseball were played in Chicago but at which ball park and in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Comiskey Park, 1933

questions.question: The first night baseball game to be played at Wrigley Field in Chicago happened on which date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: August 9, 1988

questions.question: Which White Sox hitter had the highest career batting average?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Jackson

questions.question: Former baseball player and radio/television sports announcer Philip Rizzuto can be heard on a  Meatloaf song .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: As of 2007, when was the last time that the White Sox won the World Series of baseball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2005

questions.question: What former football player from the University of Southern California was a first round draft choice of the New York Jets but caused so much turmoil that the Jets soon traded him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keyshawn Johnson

questions.question: Which of these is not a former Southern California Trojans football player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Art Shell

questions.question: Which of the following was invented before the last time that the Chicago Cubs won The World Series of baseball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The invention of Corn Flakes

questions.question: As of 2007, which team has been the winner of the most World Series of baseball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Sox

questions.question: Which statement about Philip Rizzutos birth is true?

options.text: He was born Fiero Francis Rizzuto on 25 September, 1917 in Brooklyn, N.Y.
He  was born Philip Francis Rizzuto on 25 September, 1916 in Hillside, New Jersey.
He was born Carlo Philip Rizzuto on 25  September, 1915 in The Bronx, N.Y.
He was  born Francisco Philip Rizzuto on 25 September, 1920 in Newark, New Jersey.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was born Fiero Francis Rizzuto on 25 September, 1917 in Brooklyn, N.Y.

questions.question: As of 2007, when was the last time the Chicago Cubs won the World Series of baseball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1908

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Phil Rizzuto and Gilbert Arenas
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, gilbert, yankees. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Gilbert Arenas was selected in the NBA 2006 All-Star game despite his poor averages that season thanks to the many fans that voted for him to be included.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Gilbert Arenas is famous for doing what before taking a foul shot?

options.text: He spins the ball around his waist 3 times and then dribbles the ball 3 times.
He kisses a tattoo of his baby on his left hand and of his babys mama on his right hand.
He makes the sign of the cross with his hand and looks up in the air with his eyes closed.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He spins the ball around his waist 3 times and then dribbles the ball 3 times.

questions.question: Gilbert Arenas was drafted into the NBA by what team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Golden State Warriors

questions.question: Gilbert Arenas wore the number 0 on his jersey because nobody could beat him in a one-on-one basketball game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Phil Rizzuto often said I gotta get over that  bridge. To what did this phrase refer?

options.text: He was worried about getting through the seventh inning when he got an inning off.
He was worried about getting through to the sixth inning when Bill White would take over the announcing, making  White his bridge to relaxing.
He  was worried about  getting home late because of  traffic on the George Washington Bridge to NJ.
He worried  bout the game having to go to extra innings so hed have to work overtime.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He  was worried about  getting home late because of  traffic on the George Washington Bridge to NJ.

questions.question: When did Phil Rizzuto play for the Yankees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1941-1953

questions.question: On which TV show did Phil Rizzuto appear as the first mystery guest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whats My Line?

questions.question: What was Phil Rizzutos forte?

options.text: Knocking in runners from second and third
Getting extra base hits (doubles and triples)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bunting and defense

questions.question: On February 25, 2006, Gilbert Arenas scored 46 points in less than 30 minutes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Phil Rizzuto had his number 2 retired by the New York Yankees.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these expressions was not commonly said by Phil Rizzuto as an announcer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High enough, deep enough, gone!

questions.question: In 2006, it  was announced that Phil Rizzuto had what medical problems?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: muscle atrophy andesophageal problems

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of Gilbert Arenas nicknames?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gilly-Willy

questions.question: Phil Rizzuto won the Hickok Belt which is awarded to whom?

options.text: The best announcer of the year
The best baseball player of the  year
The best defensive player in baseball
The best professional athlete of the year

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The best professional athlete of the year

questions.question: When Phil Rizzuto got death threats from a Boston Red Sox fan, what did manager Casey Stengel do?

options.text: He had Rizzuto play second base instead of  shortstop.
He sat Rizzuto so he  would be safe.
He had him change uniform numbers with another player.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had him change uniform numbers with another player.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Season and University
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, gilbert. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what year did the University of Georgia win a national title in football?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: Which quarterback did not play at the University of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Todd Blackledge

questions.question: As of 2007, the Toronto Maple Leafs have had 3 different names during their history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who was the Boston Bruins head coach during their 1971-1972 Stanley Cup winning season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Johnson

questions.question: As of 2007, of the Original Six Teams the Montreal Canadiens have the most Stanley Cup wins.  Which two Original Six teams are tied for the most Stanley Cup losses with 12?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Wings  Bruins

questions.question: As a freshman, Herschel Walker headed toward stardom when he ran completely over a linebacker from the University of Tennessee to score a touchdown. This linebacker picked himself up from the turf and went on to be a star defensive player with the Dallas Cowboys. Who is this defensive player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Bates

questions.question: As is common practice in todays NHL, most of the Original Six teams have moved into a new building over the years.  As of 2007, which of the Original Six teams has been playing in the same building the longest without moving?

options.text: Detroit Red Wings - Joe Louis Arena
New York Rangers - Madison Square Gardens

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Rangers - Madison Square Gardens

questions.question: Up to the end of the 2007 NHL season, the Original Six team who has gone the longest without winning the Stanley Cup is the Chicago Blackhawks, having last won the cup in the 1960-1961 season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following is not true about Gilbert Arenas?

options.text: He officially owns Team Final Boss, a professional Halo 2 gaming team.
He has mentored a D.C. boy who lost his family in a fire at age 10.
He has a large tent in his house converted to a low oxygen level similar to that of Colorado.
His middle name is not Jay.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His middle name is not Jay.

questions.question: The Detroit Red Wings were the last Original Six team to win the Stanley Cup.  Prior to 2006-2007 season what season was the Red Wings last Stanley Cup winning season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2001-2002

questions.question: Where did The Detroit Red Wings play their home games during the Original Six NHL era?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Olympia

questions.question: In 1980, University of Georgia running back Herschel Walker gained 1616 yards to break the previous record for most yards rushed by a freshman.  What running back held this record before Herschel broke it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pittsburghs Tony Dorsett

questions.question: Which of the following did not serve as a head coach at the University of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Dye

questions.question: What college did Gilbert Arenas play for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arizona State

questions.question: As of 2007, the Original Six team with the most Stanley Cups is The Canadiens with 24, followed by The Maple Leafs with 13.  Who is third with 10 cup wins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Wings

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Paintball and Paintballs
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, title, land. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the most common gas used in paintball guns propellants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carbon dioxide

questions.question: In paintball, you perform a Safe Velocity Test by means of what device?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Velocity chronograph

questions.question: What does the sign CGA on paintball gas tanks stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Compressed Gas Association

questions.question: What type of paint is used in most .68 calibre paintballs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Latex

questions.question: In paintball markers, tubes that hold extra paintballs while in a battle are called what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Speedloaders

questions.question: You can buy paintball guns that feed the paintballs from a clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In paintball, everybody in the game except observers is required to wear protective masks while a gun is in use.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What happens with a paintball if put in water for 24 hours or more?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It expands

questions.question: You can buy paintball land mines that are reusable.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When you go paintballing what is the first thing you do before you put the carbon dioxide tank in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Put barrel plug in

questions.question: This place kicker, who would later play for the NFL Chicago Bears, kicked a 60 yard game-winning field goal against the Clemson Tigers in 1984.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Butler

questions.question: What is the maximum temperature of a compressed 16-ounce Carbon Dioxide tank fit for a paintball gun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 130 degrees F / 55 degrees Celsius

questions.question: In paintball, which term refers to the tank that holds the paintballs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hopper

questions.question: Georgia won the Southeastern Conference title in 2005 and in 2003 defeating which two teams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arkansas and LSU

questions.question: Georgia is a proud member of the Southeastern Conference - Eastern Division, together with the 2006 National Champions, the Florida Gators. Which team is not a member of the SEC-East?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Auburn
